data.title: Abraham Lincoln State by State – Abraham Lincoln's Classroom
data.text:
Abraham Lincoln State by State

Abraham Lincoln State by State

[one_third padding=”0 35px 5px 5px”]

Abraham Lincoln and Delaware

Abraham Lincoln wasn’t a regular visitor to Delaware. He was hardly even an occasional visitor. The state wasn’t a… Read more

[/one_third]

[one_third padding=”0 35px 5px 5px”]

Abraham Lincoln and New Jersey

Abraham Lincoln frequently passed through New Jersey on the way to New York or Washington. There is no record, however, of the… Read more

[/one_third]

[one_third_last padding=”0 35px 5px 5px”]

Abraham Lincoln and Bloomington

Few towns in Illinois played a more important role in Abraham Lincoln’s legal and political development than the McLean County… Read more

[/one_third_last]

[one_third padding=”0 35px 5px 5px”]

Abraham Lincoln and California

President Lincoln very much wanted to visit California. One of his last conversations before he left for Ford’s Theater on the night of… Read more

[/one_third]

[one_third padding=”0 35px 5px 5px”]

Abraham Lincoln and Chicago

Springfield attorney Abraham Lincoln frequently went to Chicago during the 1850s on political or legal business. When appearing before… Read more

[/one_third]

Abraham Lincoln and Connecticut

[/one_third_last]

Abraham Lincoln and Indiana

Abraham Lincoln grew up in Indiana. Indiana was the state of his formation as an adolescent and it was a state that helped form his… Read more

Abraham Lincoln and Iowa

[/one_third]

[/one_third]

Abraham Lincoln and Maine

Abraham Lincoln and Minnesota

Mr. Lincoln’s relationships with New York State are covered in a separate web site: Mr. Lincoln and New York. Much of Mr. Lincoln’s activities in Illinois are covered in Mr. Lincoln and Friends and Mr. Lincoln and Freedom.
